website_summaries.verdict: A really good price on a pair of well made gaiters that hold together well and don't sag.
pros: Closes with hook-and-loop tape and a buckle
Buckle works well to help prevent sagging
Comes in black, blue, or green
Strap under the sole is heavy duty
Gators do a great job of keeping your legs warm, clean and dry
cons: These gaiters seem to run a little small

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly and didn't let us down
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs of there gaiters for our trip to Banff National Park in Alberta Canada, and they did not disapoint. When sized and installed correctly they kept all the snow and moisture out of our boots. They also kept out legs warmer. The deepest snow we hiked through was 12"+ and no issues. I read reviews from some people that the strap at the top of the leg kept coming loose, so all we did was double back the strap through the buckle after tightening it and we had zero issues. Couldn't of been happier for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh C Flowers

customer_reviews.title: the only problem is the size -- ordered a medium ...
customer_reviews.text: the only problem is the size -- ordered a medium which just fit but with extra layers will be tight. I am 5/9 thin legs someone with large calves couldn't wear a medium. Paul F
customer_reviews.author: Paul F

customer_reviews.title: Do not order larger than what you wear like some comments suggest.
customer_reviews.text: These work but the comments about sizes caused me to buy one size bigger than what I thought would fit. Sadly these are too big, I still try to wear them but they bunch up and sag. I would just order the size you think would fit and do not over compensate like some of the comment suggest. I wear Large but ordered XL, even over the baggiest pants I own were too big. I am 6'1 , 200 lbs but my calf's are not enormous.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: First pair I've ever owned and though I'm a beginner snowshoer, I know quality. They fit as described and the bonus is that you get the front lace loop that you don't typically get in this price range. Easy to take on and off and the lower portion is made of a more durable material to ensure they don't wear quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jatinder

customer_reviews.title: Size up for bigger calves
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in knee deep powder snow conditions with my snow boots while snoeshoeing! I have 15" calfs from running and a size large felt comfy with a little room...I ordered a medium size too but those were a little too snug for my taste. Gaiters stayed up for the 4 hour trek, really happy with them as I had running leggings on...and my legs stayed dry the entire time.
customer_reviews.author: CN Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Keep scree out
customer_reviews.text: I used these right after getting them and they were simple to use and did the best they could keeping scree out of my shoes. This is the second brand I have tried and these are way better than the first pair.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gaiters for hiking & backpacking. I backpacked about 25 miles last weekend and the gaiters preformed perfectly. They kept my feet dry and warm under EXTREME conditions: Rocky trail Snow Ice Torrential rain 25 miles! They performed perfectly for these 25 miles, and that alone is worth the $20 I paid for them! I bought a size M- I have average/skinny calves and size 7.5 womens shoes. I'm about 5'5".
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth L

customer_reviews.title: Great Gaiters!
customer_reviews.text: These gaiters are great! They fit well and do what they are supposed to do. Frank, the owner of the company, is very attentive and is great to work with!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run a little small
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be a quality product at a great price. We did find that they run a little small. My measurements were towards the top of the range listed for a medium, but the actual fit was too tight, and I needed to return them and order a larger size. My advice, if you’re near the top of a size range, go up a size. My husband’s measurement was right in the middle of the extra large range, and his fit great. Will update review after we’ve had a chance to see how they perform.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Cat

customer_reviews.title: Updated: Kept my leggings clean and dry while hiking ...
customer_reviews.text: Updated: Kept my leggings clean and dry while hiking Mantanuska and Exit Glaciers in Alaska in light rain. May 2018. Fit the fat calf of this 3x 5'6" grandma. I will use this while hiking in Alaska in Denali NP and Mantanska Glacier. I chose blue to coordinate with my other gear. The velcro is strong. It has a vinyl strap to go around hiking boot insteap. I would think a nylon strap would be more durable. Time will tell. Would not be impossible to replace if you were handy with a sewing machine. I did not pay a huge price for these so that might be the trade off.
customer_reviews.author: DLDC

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ballet Class with Barre exercises
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 9 year old grand daughter who wants to study dance. I know it is no substitute for taking lessons in person, where someone can watch you and help you improve your technique, but if she sticks with it, at least she will have some of the basics if she ever gets the opportunity to take dance classes. The DVD is very good in providing the subtle direction a teacher would provide as far as posture and proper turnout. It explains terminology too. I was impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear over my rubber boots, to keep rocks and dirt from getting into the boots while weed wacking. For that purpose they work very well! The XL size was just large enough to fit around the boots, and the velcro closure makes them very easy to put on. Would have given them five stars, except for the fact that the straps are a bit flimsy - the top strap tends to loosen up and needs occasional retightening. Didn't use the bottom strap, but it doesn't look like it would last very long. Buckles are plastic, and they look like they would break easily. Reasonable construction for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Keith L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to wear and durable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my trek up Mt Kilimanjaro in July. Wasn't sure exactly why I would need them but found out on summit night. Outside of the possible rain and snow up there the terrain is very loose. We were sinking in the dirt/ gravel like crazy and without these my boots would have been full of dirt and rocks!! These were super easy to put on and very durable. They took a beating for 10.5 hours straight on summit night and withstood it all no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Great for weed eating!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these intended for the use of weedeating. I have my own lawn care business and have used these for 3 weeks now. They work perfect for protecting my legs and keeping the grass out of my shoes. I’m fairly tall at 6 1’ and around a medium size built the XL is perfect for me. Order them if you need them for weed eating they work great ((Update)) 6/12/20 These things are still going strong and have lasted me two lawn seasons. I highly recommend these if your looking for something to protect your legs during lawn season while mowing. I’m gonna buy them again
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: They do not stand up!
customer_reviews.text: Leg gaiters a suppose to remain vertical while you wear them. These have no support and will slide down. It was a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Tesa W

customer_reviews.title: Size matters!
customer_reviews.text: As if you didn't know that haha. Anyway, I'm big guy 6'4" 230 pounds and I have pretty big calves, so I figured like most clothing items/accessories I should go with XL. Now it fits, but the velcro just barely catches in doing so. They're a bit big. I would have been better off with a Large as opposed to an XL. However, luckily for me they still work. Just thought I'd write this to help others regarding sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Doc5934

customer_reviews.title: They work perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Finally a pair of gaiters that fit large calves. I have 18" calf circumference + my garments (thermal underwear + hiking pants) and the gaiters fit over with a little bit of room to spare. Easy on and off. Easy purchase, shipment arrived promptly.
customer_reviews.author: annette85

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these gaiters to wear while snowshoeing. I'm only 5'2" but I have beefy calves, so ordered a medium. I might have been able to get away with a small, but I'll be layering pants, so I'll keep them. They do come all the way up to my knee, but that's not really an issue. they are flexible and fairly easy to put on. I would order again
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Bottom strap broke
customer_reviews.text: Bottom strap tore off on the first hike lasted about 5mi. I believe their just poorly stitched on. I gave them 3 stars cause they work great and fit great, if you don't need the foot strap but I have not yet been able to test them without it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Barone

customer_reviews.title: I have large calves
customer_reviews.text: These fit over my calves and pants, something I've had a lot of trouble other gaiters to do. The Velcro closure makes me suspicious of the longevity of these, but I don't use them but only 4 to 5 times a year. The lace hook can need a bit of tweaking to get it to work right, but when stepping off of a snow cat into deep snow, you don't end up with wet socks.
customer_reviews.author: Kitchen geek

customer_reviews.title: Unigear leg gaiters
customer_reviews.text: Have not had a chance to try these Gators yet as my Hunting Expedition will be getting in the near future! I'm hopeful that these Gators will keep out water and also dirt and bugs! If they provide this type of protection and the difficult terrain that I will be traversing oh, then I will be very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Majanie

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny, regardless of what the price is.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I like that the Velcro is in the front of the Gaiters. Very well made and they fit! I have very big calves and have always had difficulty finding gaiters that fit but these are worth every penny. Wore them all winter while snowshoeing. Very easy to put on too. I like that you don't have to slip it over your pants or shoes/boots. I'll be wearing them all year while out on hikes in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Get

customer_reviews.title: Built well, works effectively and was priced welll
customer_reviews.text: It was so worth its price. I hiked 16 miles in 4 inch deep snow sometimes stepping in holes that were 12 inches deep. This thing is built solid and the plastic strap below the boot holds up well, no problems at all. No moisture got into my boot at all. Let's face it if you are only going to use it a few times a year why pay 200% more than the price of this one.
customer_reviews.author: KayBee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on!
customer_reviews.text: I use these gaiters at work during the winter. Save my pants from getting soaked. Easy to put on but I am not impressed with the plastic strap that wraps under your shoe or boot. Seems super cheap, won't stay tight, rather annoying.
customer_reviews.author: rabbit@potlatch.com

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for my kilimajaro climb! I started using them on the second or third day. This was my first time ever using gaiters, and I didn’t feel them at all, they felt as part of my pants. I ordered size small. Following the size chart and they worked perfectly. I ended up giving them to the porters at the end of the climb. So I’m sure they keep on assisting someone on mt. Kilimanjaro ;)
customer_reviews.author: avital levin

customer_reviews.title: Good Product - Got the job done
customer_reviews.text: These worked great. The only complaint is that the straps above the cave tightened on the opposite side of the straps at the arch of my foot. This wasn't a problem for me aside from causing confusion as to whether or not I was wearing them on the correct legs. Not sure it mattered though. I had no problems and I walked through thick mud pits for 5 days.
customer_reviews.author: CAM

customer_reviews.title: No ticks!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wore these for the first time. I have a long leg but they fit great. No ticks!!! Was in high grass hiking and working dogs. Love them. Will not hike without them again.
customer_reviews.author: Edina White

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof hiking through ankle deep puddles/rain/snow storm
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. We just went backpacking/camping in Canaan mountain backcountry and it had been raining for a while. The path was basically a stream with numerous ankle deep puddles and shoe-sucking mud. I definitely would have had water and mud in my boots if not for these. I also stepped on several sharp-edged rocks and the straps on the bottom didn't break. These kept my feet and legs 100% dry with the help of my boots. I will buy again when I have worn these out.
customer_reviews.author: Nnywomp

customer_reviews.title: Quality product at good price
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a hiker. I got these on a whim after walking to work in the rain with a raincoat but finding my lower legs soaked. Wouldn’t a gaiter be nice, I thought. So I bought these. And they work. They fit well and are relatively easy to get on. Had to tighten strap that goes around shoe very tight so it didn’t drag. No real negatives. Nice produce.
customer_reviews.author: tribecatommy

customer_reviews.title: Don't hold up through dense brush
customer_reviews.text: My calves are 14" around and the Mediums fit fine. Holding up so far with intensive field work and thorny underbrush. Top buckle and front seam velcro make for easy putting on and taking off while wearing work boots. UPDATE: After a month of use, soft side of velcro wore away and would no longer adhere as well to the other side. So, they do not stay around my calves and keep falling. I was thinking maybe I should have gone with smalls but soon enough, stitching came undone and velcro started peeling off making them useless anyway. Doesn't look like these will make me through field season. Definitely designed for light use.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Solid gaiters for the price but would be perfect with a few easy tweaks
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well and kept the snow out well throughout the winter. Would be better if the straps on the side were on opposite sides to each gaiter to make it easier to fasten and if there was somewhere else to fasten the strap on the bottom so they didn’t flap around, but for the price they worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value. I wear a 10.5 USA male boot and have athletic calves for a realtively thin guy (5' 11" tall; 160 lbs). I bought Best for boots that have a raised arch, so that you're not walking on the vinyl covered nylon strap that goes under the boot. Slightly large for me, but still just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Water Dog

customer_reviews.title: Measure Twice
customer_reviews.text: Fabrics and construction are great. I'm 5'3", 115 lb and have ordinary calves. I wanted these to go over my hiking boots or snow boots and with jeans or snow pants. Straight jeans, mostly. I got the medium size and I could NOT have gone smaller. Glad I got Medium. Love them and can't wait to put them to the test.
customer_reviews.author: T. M. Crane

customer_reviews.title: Beware if you have giant legs
customer_reviews.text: My dad and I both have exceptionally large calves, these barely closed around our boots. I used a pair of zip ties to reinforce them and had no issues in the week we were in the field, they only really make noise if you rub them against each other so dont worry too much about that.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly great quality. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Impressed by the quality of the product. High quality bottom strap, nice buckle at the top for your calf. Not waterproof because, duh, there's a big velcro strip which is how you put it on. Regardless, they kept my pants bone dry on a springtime hike through thigh deep snow and punches through to water soaking my feet (but had waterproof socks too.. Pay attention to the sizes. I measured my calf and used that to purchase. Fit was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any outdoor activity.
customer_reviews.text: Hiking, working outdoors, doing yard or landscaping work. Indispensable protection against flying stuff, against insects and a great way to avoid exposure to disease carrying ticks. Bought an extra pair to keep around in my backpack for those spur of the moment hikes. Basic item to have handy. Dealer is courteous and prompt. Will buy again from them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: The straps which run under the arch will not stay cinched and tight. They straps are too slick and thin for the buckles to retain tension. Additionally, the ladder lock buckles face downward, so every time you step in snow, the snow pushes them upward, and releases the tension. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Beaman

customer_reviews.title: Great product Unigear!
customer_reviews.text: Great product just tried them in the snow! Light weight and easy to put on! Kept my legs warm while shoveling snow! 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Craig TalleyAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: Probably not the best in pouring rain, but would work great in marshes. Seems well built, My one complaint would be the straps that go under the boot. could be made out of real leather instead of synthetic, but it works for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for price.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put on and take off and they seem like they will hold up. I've only worn them twice so far. I use them to walk dogs in the snow. Keep my legs dry so I don't have to wear clunky snow boots. I Only wish that they were lined so they would also help keep my legs warm.
customer_reviews.author: Calico Cat

customer_reviews.title: Sizing
customer_reviews.text: While the gaiters seemed to be quite good I was disappointed in how they fit. I ordered medium however I could not close them and hook them to my boots. To close them they had to be halfway up the side of the boot. Returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Put through the wringer on Mt. Adams
customer_reviews.text: I've never used gaiters before and needed something for my summiting of Mt. Adams. It handled the snow and kept my feet and ankles dry, even when glissading back down from the mountain. I got a medium which is perfect for my 5'8 height, but my calves are huge so i could only velcro them halfway. It didn't cause a problem though thankfully and I still wore these comfortably throughout the trip.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: New, no real opinion yet
customer_reviews.text: I like that the product came when promised. I have used them only once, and that was not a real test. Just looking at them, I have concerns that the strap which goes under the sole may not be durable, but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: TIM BACHICHA

customer_reviews.title: Did the Trick
customer_reviews.text: These Gaiters performed well treading thru the snow. Easy on and off. And have since used them in the woods to fend off brier bushes. I know that they are supposed to be rated for snakes as well, but do not want to try that aspect out just yet, or never.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: They work well. Too loud to hunt in. **male sure you take a set of pliers and re pinch the grommets that hook the your laces. They feel off on me. Luckily it was on the test fin so i could gather the parts.
customer_reviews.author: JAKE HOBBS

customer_reviews.title: These fell apart very quickly
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to use for hiking in the snow, and are disappointed with the durability. These only lasted a couple of days before they started falling apart. The Velcro is pulling up from the base on one of them and the tightening strap on the top of the other one fell off. They are lightweight, and we had to size way up to fit over boots, but we are disappointed they fell apart so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a Gift
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift.. the gift recipient said they like them
customer_reviews.author: Robert C Willis

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Finally! A gaitor with a size that actually fits a large winter boot. I have a size 11 boot. I've been through 2 other brands and ended up having to give them to people with smaller boot sizes. The quality is great too.
customer_reviews.author: B. Amberson

customer_reviews.title: Good material  and construction at a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: The material is good water proof construction. The straps all seem to hold up well. Only con is the hook at the base of the front is too wide for the standard boot eyelit if that was how you were going to hook the gator. Fits fine for a shoe lace (which is what it is intended for) and it seems to hold up to the wear and tear of Normal hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Eznho

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof for what it does cover. The heel buckles both ripped off in a week. I get a lot of snow in the bottoms now. Would be infinitely better with a strap or elastic around the ankles. Don't waste your money on these.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: splendid value
customer_reviews.text: They work very well, and seem quite durable so far. One possible wear area will be the strap under the arch of my boots. Overall, i am quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Overtime Hog

customer_reviews.title: These are manufactured with high quality, durable materials. ...
customer_reviews.text: These are manufactured with high quality,durable materials. I purchased them to protect my pants while using a string trimmer. The generous velcro closures insure success for this application. My only issues relate to not having left and right gaiters. The closures should overlap to the outside of the leg and back in order to keep debris from collecting under the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Curtiss Fretfreak

customer_reviews.title: Quality garmwnr
customer_reviews.text: The gaiters arrived on time and are well made. The Medium size was plenty big enough even with heavy socks on. They will not be used until later this year, but are exactly what my granddaughter was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: dmkolling

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: Great value, they are waterproof, and they do the job. I either got two of the same feet, or the left and right are the same to cut costs. Either way, I'm going to return them and get something more breathable because it locked in my perspiration.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: needed duct tape adjustment but waterproof and durable
customer_reviews.text: straps around my boot required duct tape to keep the ends from flipping out. someone else did them for me and they lasted all season. waterproof. used in NH whites all winter.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra O.

customer_reviews.title: Chinese import.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic sole strap that MAY last a season. Made by small people who make things for small people, so size up when ordering. Although if you're a big leg trek monster look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Ross

customer_reviews.title: Good for trekking in the hot, wet forest
customer_reviews.text: I bought three pairs of these for myself and friends for our gorilla trek in Rwanda. They seem to be exactly what we need....light weight and water resistant. Update: They worked beautifully to keep our boots and pants dry and mud-free. Can't imagine expensive ones working any better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performs just as well as the higher priced gaiters
customer_reviews.text: Just took these out on a 5 mile snowshoe hike and they performed great. They did what they were supposed to do by keeping the snow out so I'm quite satisfied... and, heck they were a third of the price of the Outdoor Research gaiters my wife uses and performs the same function.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, good quality gaiters
customer_reviews.text: I have used these gaiters now for 2 winters hiking in the Catskill mountains and they are still holding up just fine. The velcro is still strong, the plastic straps on the bottom and the cinch straps at the top of the gaiters are still intact and work perfectly. I have used these walking over ice, rocky stream beds, deep snow and very steep terrain and have not had 1 issue with them. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dar M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gators for riding ATVs in the woods (also for hiking to and from camp in the wet brush) They give my legs and jeans extra protection when riding thru brush. Just what I needed. I do recommend buying an upsize to cover your jeans or outerwear.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rosinski

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected for the price. Fits great.
customer_reviews.text: My key observations: • True to size for me (size Medium). • Material and Craftsmanship quality is very good. • Snap buckles would be appreciated, but very minor for the occasional hike/backpack trip. • Weight (size M): 6.1 ounces, and length is 16.5 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Pass
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart half a mile into first use, stitching just unraveled all the way up the front!
customer_reviews.author: kelly gleason

customer_reviews.title: Good Gear so far!
customer_reviews.text: They fit well, look great, seemingly water resistant, but have not be tested yet. We leave for Japan and Kumano Kodo Saturday and will break them in and check out the durability and water test. If all goes well we'll leave our review as is; if not, we'll let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. My only reservation is regarding the size. Large is what was needed to go over my boot, but the large fits loosely around my calf.
customer_reviews.author: iw7535

customer_reviews.title: Excellent so far...
customer_reviews.text: I've only used them twice, but great so far. I like the material and design. Easy on and off. Definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Boz

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy material
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wear, like the seller stated, keeps snow out, keeps u warm and sturdy stuff material and good straps to secure it around your legs.
customer_reviews.author: DodgemanRL

customer_reviews.title: Stay tuned...
customer_reviews.text: I can't leave an honest review as we haven't used these yet. However, they are headed to Glacier NP this week, and we are confident they will serve its purpose! Shipping was fast and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: They keep snow out of my shoes
customer_reviews.text: Which is what they're designed to do. They could be a little wider around the calf, but it's not their fault I have fat calves.
customer_reviews.author: BE Kaye

customer_reviews.title: The Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: These work well but don't look impressive. I have concerns about durability, but they come with a warranty so i will expect them to last.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: They work perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I wore these while hunting in 12"-18" of snow. They sure kept my pants dry! The only bad thing is they didn't help me shoot a deer. Maybe next season!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy on a great product!
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome! I tried them out for the first time snowblowing the driveway followed up by playing the the snow with the kids and these could not have worked out any better! Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Reif

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight cover
customer_reviews.text: Bought them to wear on my hikes in Costa Rica, mostly as a removable ankle/calf cover to wear with shorts. Good protection from brush scrapes and at least some level of protection from the occasional snake.
customer_reviews.author: rjr

customer_reviews.title: Keeps snow out of boots!
customer_reviews.text: These gators are fantastic for snowshoeing and xc skiing. Be careful about measuring your calves and boot tops to order the best size for you and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Decent for the price, worked well for snow travel. But would change one thing- seems like the eyelet that hooks on to shoelaces should go first, not last.
customer_reviews.author: PEdwards

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight waterproof gaters
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Fit perfectly. Husband wore hunting kept dry and protected from weeds and briars walking in woods. Will be getting myself a pair before the next snow fall
customer_reviews.author: Cbaysore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gardening!
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent for gardening! They help keep the bottom of my pants dry and clean. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Brady D. Carnahan

customer_reviews.title: Will do the job
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used em yet for hazardous weather but seem decent. Would be nice if they were able to be modified more. For an under strap upgrade based on footwear for the larger fella. I wear a size 15 and my calves just barely fit in the top before I’ve even put long johns on.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as more expensive ones
customer_reviews.text: I used them for mud, not snow. I wore them on the West Coast Trail. They kept my socks dry-ish and free of squishy mud. Easy to put on and take off. The plastic strap under your boot doesn't look very sturdy but it lasted through a 75km hike. Others had fancier versions with elastic, but I think these worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ally Altemose

customer_reviews.title: Appear well made.
customer_reviews.text: Appear to be okay, but these are snow gaiters and this is June. No meaningful evaluation will be possible for a number of months.
customer_reviews.author: hunter

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Kept out all the stuff that gets caught in my boots including ticks. Have not been through thorns or anything yet so I cannot comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: These gaiters do a great job of keeping my boots and calves dry in this season of mud!
customer_reviews.author: RomanDruid

customer_reviews.title: Can't even hold up to snow.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: They work. Cons: They broke in less than 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: David O'Sulebheim

customer_reviews.title: Plastic junk hoping the contact the seller for a replacement
customer_reviews.text: The plastic clips should be replaced with stainless steel clips the plastic ones broke the first time out only way to fix it is to find some stainless steel clips and undo the threads and sow with some Marine thread
customer_reviews.author: Scott D. Donohoe

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny and then some. Well made and wonderful customer service. 1st ones were too small but the company sent out a replacement right away, no questions asked.
customer_reviews.author: Amity Howard

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Leg Gaiters
customer_reviews.text: Leg gaiters seem like a solid piece of outdoor gear that every serious hiker should have available.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Did the job...
customer_reviews.text: These did the job BUT they are a pain to get on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy R. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: These work as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair so I have nothing to compare them with. I used these only once in fluffy and then wet snow, they were great at keeping snow out of my boots, so they did exactly what they were supposed to. Thank you! They seem to be off good quality materials, so I hope they will last.
customer_reviews.author: svp

customer_reviews.title: Good product, runs small
customer_reviews.text: Runs a bit small. Order next size up in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: fit great and work great
customer_reviews.text: had a few big snow dumps and these work great for keeping the snow out of boots and pant cuffs
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D Nix

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is tricky
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the XL based on some of the reviews and they were way too big. I'm 5' 10" and 180lbs and I returned them for a medium which seemed to fit much better.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works well, and is durable. Fits as the chart implies.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: I use them while snow shoeing. They are easy to wear, water proof and have lasted me well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mens sz 10
customer_reviews.text: Mens sz 10 hiking boot fits well I'm about 6' 170lb , the bottom of the Gaiter is a little tight on the hikers but fit no problem with sneakers. If you have larger boots then a sz10 maybe get the Large size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for work
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my son who works in lawn care.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on an 18 mile snow showing weekend! Easy on and off. Nice slim fit. Held up! Didn’t sag.
customer_reviews.author: Seaside_ang

customer_reviews.title: They do everything that is claimed
customer_reviews.text: My feet stayed dry and no snow or wet feet.
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They look and feel sturdy and very well made. Time will tell! True to the ad description.
customer_reviews.author: Jaume

customer_reviews.title: They just work!
customer_reviews.text: Used these for the first time yesterday. Super easy to put on. No more snow down the boots!
customer_reviews.author: MrPig

customer_reviews.title: Wider than 20"
customer_reviews.text: I have 20" calves these xl gaiters leave enough room to roll and tuck my thick canvas pants in.
customer_reviews.author: LaRae smith

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the snow out
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my fiancé for snow hiking. They are a bit heavier than my O/R’s but they kept the snow and did the job! Nice gaiters and nice price!
customer_reviews.author: Nicolle Walsh

product_meta.title: Unigear Leg Gaiters, Waterproof Snow Boot Gaiters Abrasion Resistance for Outdoor Snowshoeing, Hiking, Hunting, Ice Climbing, Skiing
feature_bullets: WATER RESISTANT AND BREATHABLE – Unigear snow gaiters provide excellent combination of waterproof and breathable, waterproof rating 1000mm. The gaiters are constructed with rugged polyester and featured with waterproof membrane, which can keep moisture out and let sweat escape.

ABRASION RESISTANCE AND DURABLE – We use 600D polyester on the lower legs with high workmanship to reinforce abrasion resistance and anti-tear. The long-lasting TPU instep straps of our boot gaiters can be used in lowest temperature (-35℃/-31℉).

ADJUSTABLE FOR TIGHT FIT –The TPU instep allows for adjusting different sizes of boots and keeping them tight. Featured adjustable buckle strap on top, the hiking gaiters can fit your legs well and prevent slipping down. It’s easy to put on and take off with the front sticky Velcro.

MULTI-FUNCTIONAL: Excellent waterproof and dust proof material offers superior protection against water, rain, snow, mud, wind, sand and insects from entering into your shoes or pants to keep your legs safe and dry. Our leg gaiters excel at cold, wet-weather for Hiking, Hunting, Climbing, Mountaineering, Snowing and Skiing.

AFTER-SALES SERVICE: Please read the size chart before purchase. If you meet the size or any quality problems, please contact us for after-sales service at any time. We will offer you a solution as soon as possible.
